headline: KKR Makes AI Play With Nearly $11 Billion Asia Data-Center Deal
summary: A  KKR  -led consortium has agreed to acquire a Singapore data-center company valued at $10.9 billion, marking the U.S. firm’s largest Asia-Pacific infrastructure investment yet as the AI frenzy fuels demand for tech assets.  The group of investors, which includes Singapore telecommunications company  Singtel  will buy the rest of ST Telemedia Global Data Centres not already owned from its parent, the companies said Wednesday.  The KKR-led group already owns a minority stake in STT GDC that it acquired from parent ST Telemedia for $1.3 billion in 2024.
